attributes.action: Impact of lockdown on mental health
attributes.additional_details: Parliament acts on behalf of the people and it is their duty to safeguard mental health for all and shield the effects of the pandemic from the public. The government should set up an independent review into alternative measures to control the virus
attributes.background: I wish Parliament to look at other ways of dealing with the pandemic beyond the scope of Lockdowns. I feel healthy people are being impacted beyond the remit of the disease effects. The toll on the mental health of all should be considered and held above the pandemic in regard of future potential.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about the UK Government's approach to the Covid-19 pandemic, however it's not clear what alternative measures you want the Government to consider or adopt. 

You could start a petition calling on the Government to implement specific alternative measures in response to the pandemic, if that is something you'd like to happen.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
